Posts.Content: Hi there, You can also get bra extenders which you can use with your regular bras - makes them a lot looser so will rub less. Hope it goes well for you. J xx
Posts.Title: Bras!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Lellyv, I'm about to start chemo and got a second hand wig from https://www.wigbank.com for £25.00 - worth a look. I'm going to take a look at hip head gear too.  Bernard will die!! J xx
Posts.Title: Chemo etc

Posts.Content: Hi Henry, Yes I was thinking about you today,. Good that treatment is starting.  The mastectomy isn't too bad. I've got over mine pretty well  10 days now and doing mostly normal things except for lifting and vacuuming., Just some soreness under the arm which the breast nurse said was cording. Seeing physio after my next appt so hope they will help.  Doing the exercises afterwards is really important.Will be thinking about you on Thursday. hugs, Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty, whoops not Henry!! Yes I was thinking about you today,. Good that treatment is starting.  The mastectomy isn't too bad. I've got over mine pretty well  10 days now and doing mostly normal things except for lifting and vacuuming., Just some soreness under the arm which the breast nurse said was cording. Seeing physio after my next appt so hope they will help.  Doing the exercises afterwards is really important.Will be thinking about you on Thursday. hugs, Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi  sunshine -19 Just sending you some gentle hugs and a prayer for you. you will get through this and come out stronger J
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Angela, Just picked up your message. Glad you're feeling calmer. When everything is so big things that would normally not phase us have a huge impact, totally relate to that. I did wonder if they might actually be bringing your op forward but you will know tomorrow and hoping and praying it will go ahead on or before your May date. So glad you're getting your hair cut - I had mine done last week. My hairdresser was so kind, he made it a lot shorter as chemo will happen in a few weeks so it won't be so drastic when I lose it!  He also said to take in the wig I got (not sure if I mentioned I got one for £25.00 from  https://www.wigbank.com  ) and he's going to cut it so it really suits me. Having your hair done will make you feel much better. Hope you will get a good night's sleep and all goes well tomorrow. love and hugs, Janet xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Sophie It sounds like you need to have more time off. Take it slowly, look after yourself. Do some pampering. Janet xxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Angela, That's brilliant news and so glad you are first in, that saves more waiting around. Yes it will be good to have it over and know that a huge part of your treatment is done. I'm 3 weeks on now and can do most things as normal though still get a bit tired now and then. What time is your op? I will remember to pray for you on the day. I have an echo cardiogram on the 9th too - a check to make sure my heart is OK for the chemo - on it goes but all for a good outcome. love and hugs, Janet  xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty, Just to let you know I'm still thinking about you and really hoping for good results for you next week. It always seems there is a wait for something else and the waiting can be worse than the appointment. I was told they do a bone scan and CT scan so they have a baseline to work with. They know what is normal for you and can track any changes.  Looking back through the posts it sounds  like you are doing really really well now, I think we are all stronger than we think we are though of course we have those 'moments' . I had one on Saturday when my daughter came up to visit with grandson. I felt very emotional when they left - not sure why!  Lots of love and hugs and keep going!  Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Angela, Lovely to see you on the forum again - was wondering how it was going. Sorry you've had issues with healing  - hoping and praying for good outcome. I'll be at the hospital on Tues too for the 1st round of chemo- all a bit scary but glad to get it started- the sooner it states he sooner it will be over! love and hugs Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Thank you! Hope you are recovering well. Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henry, I completely understand and going to those dark places is completely natural. Facing your deepest fears is actually being incredibly brave and strong. It is not a weakness. We'll be thinking of you on Thursday - there is always a way through. hugs Janet xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty,  I'm just 3 weeks ahead of you - diagnosed on 14th March. I know exactly how you feel but it does get better. The waiting for more test results is probably the worst time but once you know more it is much easier to cope. Life has changed dramatically and yes it's going to be very different. We will both come through this and out the other side stronger people. I have loads of people praying for me  which I feel is really helping - I don't know if this is your thing but more than happy to say one for you if it helps. Be prepared for treatment plans to change I was first going to have chemo then surgery but now it is the other way round and found out on Thursday it is mastectomy on Monday but glad treatment will start. Hang on in there. You are a beautiful person whatever happens and you will always be beautiful. J
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Great that you won't need any more treatment - good news! Thanks for the prayers much valued. Janet xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty, So glad you're feeling better. The worst time for me was def those first 3 days. There is so much treatment now and amazing drugs.I had a mastectomy on Monday and it wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be, even emotionally. So glad your family are supporting you that counts for so much. It will be a long haul but you will get through it and come through a stronger person. Sending you a hug love Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henry, How are things going with you? I ws thinking about you yesterday and hope the surgery went well. The next few days will be uncomfortable with the drain and everything but things will get better. I had my bandages off yesterday and am able to drive again so feeling a lot more normal. The next treatment is chemo which Im not looking forward to but without it they can't be sure all the cancer is gone. That will start in a few weeks so having a little bit of normality! Take care of yourself, treat yourself and have lots of rest.  Let others look after you. love and prayers Janet xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty I had a CT scan and bone scan before mastectomy. I also had an echocardiogram today to check my heart would take the chemo. The technician told me it was fine. I think all these scans are normal - part of the ride. Try not to worry, none of them are painful or uncomfortable. They didn't tell me results of the scans on the day so unfortunately another wait, but they did come out clear:) I've been finding things to do like growing stuff in the greenhouse and a bit of watercolour painting. It takes my mind off it all - this is a time when we can do some those things we never normally have time for! Hope you are recovering OK.  I've had some under arm pain and other weird pains too but they seem to be resolving now, guess it takes a while. Sending  love and hugs Janet
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty,  So glad you're recovering well. Yes the drains are a nuisance -  it was exactly the same with me, hopefully they will be out soon. Good that you'r e feeling better too. It is overwhelming but people are here for you and you are loved. We will all get through this.  love and gentle hugs, Janet xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Henty, I know how you’re feeling. I had my pre med straight after being told it was mastectomy and my bp was through the roof! I’m 2 weeks post mastectomy now and feel so much better knowing the tumour is gone. Try taking deep yoga style breaths, breath in counting to 4 and out counting for 4. My yoga teacher always says breath in ‘let’ breath out ‘go’. I’ll be thinking of you tomorrow and esp. on Thursday. This is such a big thing for all of us . you are not alone and you are loved. Janet xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Thanks Pollydog - I feel I have it easy compared to you with your two boys and a job. I'm 69 and retired with a husband of 2 years who is really supportive. I've had to give up my volunteer work mostly church related but others are filling the gaps. I've two daughters both with 2-3 year olds and another on the way. I've been looking after one while her mum works but the other grandma has stepped in. Have you started chemo yet? Sending prayers and hugs to you too. Staying positive is the key and good nutrition to help the body fight. Janet  xxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Doing really well. Underam still painful but otherwise pretty much back to normal. + daughter and granddaughter (nearly 3) arriving soon for a couple of days:)   Seeing BCN tomorrow to look at wound.Hope your appt goes well and you can agree suitable treatment. Hugs  xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I am in - had first chemo on 21st May  Docetaxel and cyclophosphamide  then Herceptn on 22nd. I have 3 more cycles to go. So far have just felt really tired, esp on Day 4 when in felt like chemo cosh but now  day 6 feeling a lot better. Have achy joints feels like the flu.  Best wishes and hugs to everyone else out there! J
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**
